name: The De Vere Grand Brighton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was by far the worst supposedly 5* hotel I have ever stayed in and at high season prices of £260 absoutely not worth the money. The reception service was efficient but not overly friendly and bizarrely we were asked to pay for our room in advance - perhaps because they suspected we would not want to pay once we had seen it. A poky little double room, tired and grubby furnishings and a very basic bathroom situated right next to what appeared to be the entire buildings generators littered with numerous cigarette butts. Said generator then proceeded to switch on and off throughout the night keeping us both awake. Altogether a very disappointing experience - we will be sticking with the smaller boutique hotels next time, don't waste your money here.
reviews.title: Very Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Partner and I stayed in the hotel over the August Bank Holiday after our Civil Partnership and really enjoyed it. The staff were all very professional and friendly, they really made an effort from the minute we arrived. Our bags were taken to our room while we had a drink in the lounge, it was effortless.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Hotel

likes.liked: — The Building and Decor was lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our room was a newly refurbished room with a sea view and was amazing and although the room was very modern it did not take away from the charm of the hotel.
reviews.title: Competition win, a great experience

likes.liked: — The atmosphere and the friendliness of the staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had afternoon tea on Sunday when we did not book enough places for our guests but the staff were very good and got extra tables and chairs without making a fuss.
reviews.title: Grand - Pure Luxury!
Not So Grand!!
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is thinking of visiting Brighton.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been trying to visit Brighton for a quite a while and on our recent trip to London decided that this would be the time to visit. No other hotel came to mind as The Grand is a famous hotel and we knew it was right on the seafront.
reviews.title: Dreadful and in need of desperate repair

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011
reviews.text: On our arrival, the taxi driver informed us we had picked the best hotel in Brighton, as there are only two 5 star hotels and this was the best. We were greeted by an efficient concierge who immediately relieved us of our bags so that we could get checked in. On check in, I was informed the room was not ready and if I wanted to take a seat in the bar they would prioritise my checking in. I arrived at 1 pm and consumed two capuccinos (£3.75 each) whilst waiting. Despite sitting until 2.30 pm and also reminding the staff that I would like to freshen up before meeting an old friend for lunch, I had to leave before the room was ready. I had to freshen up in the ladies powder room. (On our visit to the capital we had arrived at the hotel at 11 am and were immediately shown to our room.)
reviews.title: Always a pleasurable stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had pad extra for a seaview as it would be foolish not to take advantage of such a wonderful location. On returning to the hotel, our room was on the seventh floor and was extremely disappointing to say the least. The three windows overlooking the seafront were high and as I am only a petite lady I struggled to take in the view unless I stood on tiptoe. The windows were very dirty, with peeling paint around the edges. The furniture in the room was shabby (lamps with lopsided shades), a delapidated sofa that was in desperate need of reupholstery and a blanket box that was as old as I was. The wallpaper was peeling and despite the supposed 5 star status the minibar was unstocked.
reviews.title: Wonderful good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately the bathroom was no better - wires hanging out of the towel warmer and a shower that was so low on pressure we had to chase the water around the bath to wash.
reviews.title: Elegant style with food to die for:

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took advantage of the nightlife of Brighton and despite arriving back at the hotel at 1245 am the bar was closed. We did manage to find a friendly bar person who said we could arrange a drink on room service to take back to our room. I was over the moon to have to enjoy a nightcap in such shabby surroundings.
reviews.title: It really is grand

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stayed here during GPA Annual Dinner. Changed reservation due to reading about bed bugs at our original choice - The Old Ship.
reviews.title: Great hotel. You get what you pay for.

likes.liked: — Central location. Great staff. Beautiful decor
likes.disliked: — Expensive drinks at the bar. Guess it goes with the territoriy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Very glad we changed. Beautiful room and very quiet (as requested). No sea view, but the company was paying so no complaints.
reviews.title: One night was enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Grand public rooms, but expensive for drinks (£17 for two vodka tonics a bit on the high side). Buy the champagne, better value!!
reviews.title: Efficient staff, well appointed rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ordered champagne/flowers/chocolates for the room which arrived on time and very good value.
reviews.title: Not bad, Not Brilliant

likes.liked: — Location! right opposite the burnt west pier (shame we couldnt see it from our room)
likes.disliked: — not being able to see anything from our room, except the staff room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great room, cleanliness, double windows etc. Nothing to fault, really. Breakfast very good, in beautiful dining room. We didn't have dinner or lunch there, but looking at the menus afterwards, we wished we had.
reviews.title: Awful!!!
Traditional
reviews.text: The lobby area and entrance are very ornate and welcome and indeed, grand as the name suggests. We also liked the fact that you just pull up outside and the car is taken away to be parked and returned on request (note that this isn't cheap £25 per 24 hours). Our room was really large and we had specifically booked one with a sea view, which we got. Unfortunately it was rather chilly in our room however once we asked someone to look at this a heater was brought up and the heating was fixed fairly quickly so it soon warmed up. There are some aspects which could do with modernising but it is a very traditional hotel with very good service. If you do opt for a sea view room ask for one on a high floor, we were on the first floor and it was very noisy with non stop traffic through th enight. I met a friend for coffee in the bar area and there was a lovely atmospher with a pianist playing for the whole time we were there. would definitely recommend the experience of staying at the Grand.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a "treat" my partner and I (plus small dog) stayed in the Grand over New Year. The room was perpetually hot and very noisy (traffic noise night and day). The over-heating should have been sorted out, but the engineers took away our remote to the air conditioning unit on the 2nd day, expressed sympathy and we never saw them again.
reviews.title: No Longer Grand

likes.disliked: — The over heated rooms and lack of working minibar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The minibar could not be opened - it took 24 hours to sort out. And bizarrely no water was in it anyway. We were dehydrated and miserable by the 2nd afternoon.On my 3rd time of ringing to complain we were rewarded with a complimentary luke warm bottle of mineral water to try and apease us. But the heat continued. We couldn't go down to the Bar as dogs are not permitted in ANY public areas.
reviews.title: Over Priced for what it is

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Every afternoon our rest was interrupted by a housekeeping manager demanding to know by knocking on the door whether our room cleaning was okay. With a dog (and my partner disabled in a wheelchair) I was not terribly interested in their quality checks. I had gone there for a rest but we were both very happy to get back to our flat on 2nd January. It was extremely expensive (about £1,400 and not a happy experience at all).
reviews.title: Not a bad hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The days of the hotel being even 4 star seem very distant. Indifferent staff (other than our chambermaid who was lovely and helpful). I understand it is to be refurbished soon as it is no longer owned by the DeVere group. LOng over due in my opinion.
reviews.title: Grand building? Yes. Grand service and accommodaton? Not throughout.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011
reviews.text: Room: I stayed in a standard double on business. The room was like a cell. It had windows but they were blacked out and did not open and were rusty. I had to do some work and it was horrible to work in and the Internet connection did not work. The TV was tiny and there was a tiny selection of channels, not even all the terrestrial ones, and the reception was rubbish. I could bit get a signal on my phone. Furniture etc seriously old fashioned. Rust in the tiny bathroom. Bed very comfortable however.
reviews.title: Grand it's not.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pubic areas: old fashioned. The outside of the hotel needs a paint.
reviews.title: Comfortable Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service: ok but nothing special.
reviews.title: Nolonger grand

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Location: perfect.
reviews.title: 5 Star Hotel with service to match

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Breakfast: really good. Fresh and loads of choice.
reviews.title: Enjoyed it too much to get my camera out taking pictures of hotel faults !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Just returned from a six day stay at The Grand in Brighton
reviews.title: Another great stay at The Grand

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: It was so nice to stay in a hotel where every member of staff greeted you with a smile and an offer of help. They all seem to work as a team to ensure guest satisfaction.
reviews.title: A top venue in Brighton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This attitude is sadly lacking in so many hotels but definitely not at The Grand Brighton.
reviews.title: Life enhancing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well done!
reviews.title: Very Grand!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: We live in Brighton and visit The Grand for Sunday lunch from time to time. Last week we went there for a meeting with some relatives of whom we had previously been aware: the staff looked after us in fine style, turned out to be excellent photographers and spent time keeping the children entetained.
reviews.title: A home from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights and were absolutely delighted. My partner and I stayed in one of the suites on the fourth floor and were blown away. Walk in wardrobe! enormous bed! Incredible sea view!
reviews.title: Wonderfully relaxing stay in luxury and comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the only tiny tiny negative was that the TV was a bit dated - would have been nice to have a slightly more modern one to avoid that annoying flickering.
reviews.title: A hotel that looks after its guests

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff were nothing short of spectacular. All were friendly, accomodating and really went the extra mile to help you - even little things like carrying a small suitcase down the three steps at the front for you. It was really old-school fantastic customer service, and as a result the atmosphere was fantastic.
reviews.title: The Perfect Seaside Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the breakfast was to die for - loads of variety, and really good quality food. We also stayed one night for an evening meal which was equally lovely (though the lighting was very dim! )
reviews.title: #11? I Guess You Get What You Pay For! Not So Grand...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to everyone - what a fantastic place to stay.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel - stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed at the De Vere Grand for one night midweek in July.
reviews.title: 5* does not equal luxury
English Old Charm but Overpriced
reviews.text: I booked a standard room on Laterooms for £150 as opposed to the full rate of £230, so I was fairly sure I was going to be allocated the worst room they could muster!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Check-in was efficient but unfriendly - I was obviously customer number 3624 that day. I was not offered assitance with my luggage, even with three porters hanging around the concierge desk, and with me clearly struggling with loads of bags.
reviews.title: A charming and friendly hotel

likes.disliked: — decor getting a little bit tired

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The foyer and bar area of the hotel are certainly 'grand', if a little dated. I was concerned that I would be a little underdressed for a 5* hotel, but seeing blokes walking around in jeans and t-shirts assured me that I was not!
reviews.title: Saturday night only!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was spacious but tired. A very 1960's carpet was frayed in parts, and some lovely gaffer tape held it together in others! You get a decent TV (with Sky Sports), a minibar and a nice bathroom. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean, although I recognised the bed linen from a not-so-posh hotel I used to work in! The bathroom was pretty good and the shower was nice and powerful, but the room itself could quite easily have been from any old 3*. The room folder does inform you of a planned £30m refurbishment, and I can certainly confirm that it is needed.
reviews.title: Shabby

aka: The De Vere Grand Brighton Hotel
description: This is a truly remarkable hotel. An iconic Victorian building, it stands centre stage on the vibrant Brighton seafront and is a local landmark. Magnificent, imposing and the epitome of luxury. This is The Grand, Brighton. Following a recent extensive refurbishment, The Grand experience is one you will never forget. It's in the splendour of the 123 step sweeping staircase, the exquisite textures in the bedrooms, the delectable cuisine in GB1 restaurant and the sumptuous surroundings of the Spa. It's in the stunning seaviews and the warmth with which you are welcomed. It's in its innate sense of style. The magnificent Grand is a popular location for films and television shows. Coronation Street, Eastenders and Only Fools and Horses have all shot episodes in the hotel. For the complete Brighton experience, it has to be The Grand, Brighton.
